titleStmt.title: Henry C. Burnett to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7537

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Cadiz Decr 11th 1865
Honbl Thos E Bramlette
Govenor of Kenty
Frankfort
Sir

Mssrs E H Daniel & Bro have pending against them in the Caldwell Circuit Court four Indictments -- No 1. Keeping a Gaming House -- No 2 setting up a "Jenny Lind" Table upon which money or other valuable thing was won or lost and Two Indictments for permitting minors to play upon said Table. -- I have been at the Caldwell Court for two weeks, my information is, and I obtained it from Citizens and from hearing several cases for the same offences tried -- That it was not the purpose of any of these parties to set up gaming Tables or to induce Gaming and that really no money was won and lost upon the Tables -- that young men and the Officers and Soldiers would go into the saloon kept by these Gentlemen and play, and all that was ever bet upon their Table was Liquors and Cigars -- They are deserving young Men and poor, and if tried and convicted the fines will ruin them= And as you have pardoned parties charged with the same offences -- I have at their instance addressed you and hope under the Circumstances and
and the unsettled condition in which our country has been you will relieve these parties.

I have the honor to be
very respectfully
yr obt servt
H. C. Burnett

Caldwell Cir Ct
vs
E. H and R. T Daniels
Indicted for Keeping Gaming House & allowing Minors to play on Jenny Lind Table
Remitted
13 Feby/66
